verses.verse: The word<WH1697> that Jeremiah<WH3414> the prophet<WH5030> spake<WH1696> unto Baruch<WH1263> the son<WH1121> of Neriah<WH5374>, when he wrote<WH3789> these words<WH1697> in a book<WH5612> at the mouth<WH6310> of Jeremiah<WH3414>, in the fourth<WH7243> year<WH8141> of Jehoiakim<WH3079> the son<WH1121> of Josiah<WH2977>, king<WH4428> of Judah<WH3063>, saying<WH559>,
Thus saith<WH559> Jehovah<WH3068>, the God<WH430> of Israel<WH3478>, unto thee<WH1263>, O Baruch:
Thou didst say<WH559>, Woe<WH188> is me now<WH3068>! for Jehovah hath added<WH3254> sorrow<WH3015> to my pain<WH4341>; I am weary<WH3021> with my groaning<WH585>, and I find<WH4672> no rest<WH4496>.

Thus shalt thou say<WH559> unto him<WH559>, Thus saith Jehovah<WH3068>: Behold<WH1129>, that which I have built will I break down<WH2040>, and that which I have planted<WH5193> I will pluck up<WH5428>; and this in the whole land<WH776>.

And seekest<WH1245> thou great things<WH1419> for thyself<WH1245>? seek them not<WH935>; for, behold, I will bring evil<WH7451> upon all flesh<WH1320>, saith<WH5002> Jehovah<WH3068>; but thy life<WH5315> will I give<WH5414> unto thee for a prey<WH7998> in all places<WH4725> whither thou goest<WH3212>.
